csharp.using: System, System.Collections.Generic, System.Text, System.Diagnostics, System.Xml.Serialization, DISnet.DataStreamUtilities

class.name: Domain
class.comment: A special class to contain and act as a super class for Domain enumerations.

attribute.name: value
attribute.comment: domain field containing enumeration value. See SISO enumerations for PlatformDomain uid 8, MunitionDomain uid 14 and SupplyDomain uid 600.

class.name: AcousticEmitter
class.comment: Information about a specific UA emitter. Section 6.2.2.

attribute.name: acousticSystemName
attribute.comment: The system for a particular UA emitter, and an enumeration

attribute.name: acousticFunction
attribute.comment: The function of the acoustic system

attribute.name: acousticIDNumber
attribute.comment: The UA emitter identification number relative to a specific system

class.name: AggregateIdentifier
class.comment: The unique designation of each aggregate in an exercise is specified by an aggregate identifier record. The aggregate ID is not an entity and shall not be treated as such. Section 6.2.3.

attribute.name: simulationAddress
attribute.comment: Simulation address, i.e. site and application, the first two fields of the entity ID provides a unique identifier

attribute.name: aggregateID
attribute.comment: The aggregate ID provides a unique identifier

class.name: AggregateMarking
class.comment: Specifies the character set used in the first byte, followed by up to 31 characters of text data. Section 6.2.4.

attribute.name: characterSet
attribute.comment: The character set

attribute.name: characters
attribute.comment: The characters

class.name: AggregateType
class.comment: Identifies the type and organization of an aggregate. Section 6.2.5

attribute.name: aggregateKind
attribute.comment: Grouping criterion used to group the aggregate. Enumeration from EBV document

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc.) where zero means domain does not apply.

attribute.name: country
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: category
attribute.comment: category of entity

attribute.name: subcategory
attribute.comment: subcategory of entity

attribute.name: specificInfo
attribute.comment: specific info based on subcategory field. specific is a reserved word in sql.

class.name: AngularVelocityVector
class.comment: Angular velocity measured in radians per second out each of the entity's own coordinate axes. Order of measurement is angular velocity around the x, y, and z axis of the entity. The positive direction is determined by the right hand rule. Section 6.2.7

attribute.name: x
attribute.comment: velocity about the x axis

attribute.name: y
attribute.comment: velocity about the y axis

attribute.name: z
attribute.comment: velocity about the zaxis

class.name: AntennaLocation
class.comment: Location of the radiating portion of the antenna, specified in world coordinates and entity coordinates. Section 6.2.8

attribute.name: antennaLocation
attribute.comment: Location of the radiating portion of the antenna in world coordinates

attribute.name: relativeAntennaLocation
attribute.comment: Location of the radiating portion of the antenna in entity coordinates

class.name: APA
class.comment: Additional Passive Activity for use by Underwater Acoustic (UA) PDU. Section 7.6.4

primitive.comment: 14 bits of index, 2 bits of status
values shall be in units corresponding to the state change (such as dB and RPM)

class.name: Appearance
class.comment: used in AppearancePdu

class.name: BeamAntennaPattern
class.comment: Used when the antenna pattern type field has a value of 1. Specifies the direction, pattern, and polarization of radiation from an antenna. Section 6.2.9.2

attribute.name: beamDirection
attribute.comment: The rotation that transforms the reference coordinate sytem into the beam coordinate system. Either world coordinates or entity coordinates may be used as the reference coordinate system, as specified by the reference system field of the antenna pattern record.

attribute.name: azimuthBeamwidth
attribute.comment: Full width of the beam to the -3dB power density points in the x-y plane of the beam coordinnate system. Elevation beamwidth is represented by a 32-bit floating point number in units of radians.

attribute.name: elevationBeamwidth
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the full width of the beam to the –3 dB power density points in the x-z plane of the beam coordinate system. Elevation beamwidth shall be represented by a 32-bit floating point number in units of radians.

attribute.name: referenceSystem
attribute.comment: The reference coordinate system wrt which beam direction is specified. This field should not change over the duration of an exercise. World coordindate systemis prefered for exercises. The entity coordinate system should be used only when highly directional antennas must be precisely modeled.

attribute.name: ez
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the magnitude of the Z-component (in beam coordinates) of the Electrical field at some arbitrary single point in the main beam and in the far field of the antenna.

attribute.name: ex
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the magnitude of the X-component (in beam coordinates) of the Electri- cal field at some arbitrary single point in the main beam and in the far field of the antenna.

attribute.name: phase
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the phase angle between EZ and EX in radians. If fully omni-direc- tional antenna is modeled using beam pattern type one, the omni-directional antenna shall be repre- sented by beam direction Euler angles psi, theta, and phi of zero, an azimuth beamwidth of 2PI, and an elevation beamwidth of PI

class.name: Association
class.comment: An entity's associations with other entities and/or locations. For each association, this record shall specify the type of the association, the associated entity's EntityID and/or the associated location's world coordinates. This record may be used (optionally) in a transfer transaction to send internal state data from the divesting simulation to the acquiring simulation (see 5.9.4). This record may also be used for other purposes. Section 6.2.9

attribute.name: associationType
attribute.comment: This field shall indicate the type of association. It shall be represented by an 8-bit enumeration. Values for this field are found in Section 14 of SISO-REF-010

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

attribute.name: associatedEntityID
attribute.comment: identity of associated entity. If none, NO_SPECIFIC_ENTITY

attribute.name: associatedLocation
attribute.comment: location, in world coordinates

class.name: Attribute
class.comment: Used to convey information for one or more attributes. Attributes conform to the standard variable record format of 6.2.82. Section 6.2.10.

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: The record type for this attribute. Enumeration

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: Total length of the record in octets, including padding. The record shall end on a 64-bit boundary after any padding. = 6 + K + P

attribute.name: recordSpecificFields
attribute.comment: The attribute data format conforming to that specified by the record type. K bytes long

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: BeamData
class.comment: Describes the scan volue of an emitter beam. Section 6.2.11.

attribute.name: beamAzimuthCenter
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam azimuth an elevation centers and corresponding half-angles to describe the scan volume

attribute.name: beamAzimuthSweep
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam azimuth sweep to determine scan volume

attribute.name: beamElevationCenter
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam elevation center to determine scan volume

attribute.name: beamElevationSweep
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam elevation sweep to determine scan volume

attribute.name: beamSweepSync
attribute.comment: allows receiver to synchronize its regenerated scan pattern to that of the emmitter. Specifies the percentage of time a scan is through its pattern from its origion.

class.name: ChangeOptions
class.comment: This is a bitfield. See section 6.2.13 aka B.2.41

class.name: BeamStatus
class.comment: Information related to the status of a beam. This is contained in the beam status field of the electromagnitec emission PDU. The first bit determines whether the beam is active (0) or deactivated (1). Section 6.2.12.

attribute.name: beamState
attribute.comment: First bit zero means beam is active, first bit = 1 means deactivated. The rest is padding.

class.name: ClockTime
class.comment: Time measurements that exceed one hour are represented by this record. The first field is the hours since the unix epoch (Jan 1 1970, used by most Unix systems and java) and the second field the timestamp units since the top of the hour. Section 6.2.14

attribute.name: hour
attribute.comment: Hours in UTC

attribute.name: timePastHour
attribute.comment: Time past the hour

class.name: DirectedEnergyDamage
class.comment: Damage sustained by an entity due to directed energy. Location of the damage based on a relative x,y,z location from the center of the entity. Section 6.2.15.2

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: DE Record Type.

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: DE Record Length (bytes)

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

attribute.name: damageLocation
attribute.comment: location of damage, relative to center of entity

attribute.name: damageDiameter
attribute.comment: Size of damaged area, in meters

attribute.name: temperature
attribute.comment: average temp of the damaged area, in degrees celsius. If firing entitty does not model this, use a value of -273.15

attribute.name: fireEventID
attribute.comment: For any component damage resulting this field shall be set to the fire event ID from that PDU.

class.name: DataFilterRecord
class.comment: identify which of the optional data fields are contained in the Minefield Data PDU or requested in the Minefield Query PDU. This is a 32-bit record. For each field, true denotes that the data is requested or present and false denotes that the data is neither requested nor present. Section 6.2.16

attribute.name: bitFlags
attribute.comment: Bitflags field

class.name: UnsignedDISInteger
class.comment: container class not in specification

attribute.name: val
attribute.comment: unsigned integer

class.name: DataQueryDatumSpecification
class.comment: List of fixed and variable datum records. Section 6.2.17

attribute.name: numberOfFixedDatums
attribute.comment: Number of fixed datums

attribute.name: numberOfVariableDatums
attribute.comment: Number of variable datums

attribute.name: fixedDatumIDList
attribute.comment: variable length list fixed datum IDs

attribute.name: variableDatumIDList
attribute.comment: variable length list variable datum IDs

class.name: DatumSpecification
class.comment: List of fixed and variable datum records. Section 6.2.18

attribute.name: numberOfFixedDatums
attribute.comment: Number of fixed datums

attribute.name: numberOfVariableDatums
attribute.comment: Number of variable datums

attribute.name: fixedDatumIDList
attribute.comment: variable length list fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatumIDList
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable datums

class.name: MunitionDescriptor
class.comment: Represents the firing or detonation of a munition. Section 6.2.19.2

attribute.name: munitionType
attribute.comment: What munition was used in the burst

attribute.name: warhead
attribute.comment: type of warhead enumeration

attribute.name: fuse
attribute.comment: type of fuse used enumeration

attribute.name: quantity
attribute.comment: how many of the munition were fired

attribute.name: rate
attribute.comment: rate at which the munition was fired

class.name: ExplosionDescriptor
class.comment: Explosion of a non-munition. Section 6.2.19.3

attribute.name: explodingObject
attribute.comment: Type of the object that exploded. See 6.2.30

attribute.name: explosiveMaterial
attribute.comment: Material that exploded. Can be grain dust, tnt, gasoline, etc. Enumeration

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

attribute.name: explosiveForce
attribute.comment: Force of explosion, in equivalent KG of TNT

class.name: ExpendableDescriptor
class.comment: Burst of chaff or expendible device. Section 6.2.19.4

attribute.name: expendableType
attribute.comment: Type of the object that exploded

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: DirectedEnergyAreaAimpoint
class.comment: DE Precision Aimpoint Record. Section 6.2.20.2

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: Type of Record enumeration

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: Length of Record

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

attribute.name: beamAntennaPatternRecordCount
attribute.comment: Number of beam antenna pattern records

attribute.name: directedEnergyTargetEnergyDepositionRecordCount
attribute.comment: Number of DE target energy depositon records

attribute.name: beamAntennaParameterList
attribute.comment: list of beam antenna records. See 6.2.9.2

attribute.name: directedEnergyTargetEnergyDepositionRecordList
attribute.comment: list of DE target deposition records. See 6.2.21.4

class.name: DirectedEnergyPrecisionAimpoint
class.comment: DE Precision Aimpoint Record. Section 6.2.20.3

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: Type of Record

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: Length of Record

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

attribute.name: targetSpotLocation
attribute.comment: Position of Target Spot in World Coordinates.

attribute.name: targetSpotEntityLocation
attribute.comment: Position (meters) of Target Spot relative to Entity Position.

attribute.name: targetSpotVelocity
attribute.comment: Velocity (meters/sec) of Target Spot.

attribute.name: targetSpotAcceleration
attribute.comment: Acceleration (meters/sec/sec) of Target Spot.

attribute.name: targetEntityID
attribute.comment: Unique ID of the target entity.

attribute.name: targetComponentID
attribute.comment: Target Component ID ENUM, same as in DamageDescriptionRecord.

attribute.name: beamSpotType
attribute.comment: Spot Shape ENUM.

attribute.name: beamSpotCrossSectionSemiMajorAxis
attribute.comment: Beam Spot Cross Section Semi-Major Axis.

attribute.name: beamSpotCrossSectionSemiMinorAxis
attribute.comment: Beam Spot Cross Section Semi-Major Axis.

attribute.name: beamSpotCrossSectionOrientationAngle
attribute.comment: Beam Spot Cross Section Orientation Angle.

attribute.name: peakIrradiance
attribute.comment: Peak irradiance

class.name: DirectedEnergyTargetEnergyDeposition
class.comment: DE energy depostion properties for a target entity. Section 6.2.20.4

attribute.name: targetEntityID
attribute.comment: Unique ID of the target entity.

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

attribute.name: peakIrradiance
attribute.comment: Peak irradiance

class.name: BlankingSector
class.comment: The Blanking Sector attribute record may be used to convey persistent areas within a scan volume where emitter power for a specific active emitter beam is reduced to an insignificant value. Section 6.2.21.2

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: record type

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: The length of the Blanking Sector attribute record in octets.

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

attribute.name: emitterNumber
attribute.comment: indicates the emitter system for which the blanking sector values are applicable

attribute.name: beamNumber
attribute.comment: indicates the beam for which the blanking sector values are applicable.

attribute.name: stateIndicator
attribute.comment: indicate if blanking sector data have changed since issuance of the last Blanking Sector attribute record for this beam, if the Blanking Sector attribute record beam has ceased

attribute.name: leftAzimuth
attribute.comment: This field is provided to indicate the left-most azimuth (clockwise in radians) for which emitted power is reduced. This angle is measured in the X-Y plane of the radar's entity coor- dinate system (see 1.4.3). The range of permissible values is 0 to 2PI, with zero pointing in the X- direction.

attribute.name: rightAzimuth
attribute.comment: Indicate the right-most azimuth (clockwise in radians) for which emitted power is reduced. This angle is measured in the X-Y plane of the radar's entity coordinate system (see 1.4.3). The range of permissible values is 0 to 2PI , with zero pointing in the X- direction.

attribute.name: lowerElevation
attribute.comment: This field is provided to indicate the lowest elevation (in radians) for which emit- ted power is reduced. This angle is measured positive upward with respect to the X-Y plane of the radar's entity coordinate system (see 1.4.3). The range of permissible values is -PI/2 to PI/2

attribute.name: upperElevation
attribute.comment: This field is provided to indicate the highest elevation (in radians) for which emitted power is reduced. This angle is measured positive upward with respect to the X-Y plane of the radar's entitycoordinatesystem(see1.4.3). The range of permissible values is -PI/2 to PI/2

attribute.name: residualPower
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the residual effective radiated power in the blanking sector in dBm.

attribute.name: padding3
attribute.comment: Padding, 32-bits

class.name: AngleDeception
class.comment: The Angle Deception attribute record may be used to communicate discrete values that are associated with angle deception jamming that cannot be referenced to an emitter mode. The values provided in the record records (provided in the associated Electromagnetic Emission PDU). (The victim radar beams are those that are targeted by the jammer.) Section 6.2.21.2.2

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: record type

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: The length of the record in octets.

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

attribute.name: emitterNumber
attribute.comment: indicates the emitter system for which the angle deception values are applicable.

attribute.name: beamNumber
attribute.comment: indicates the jamming beam for which the angle deception values are applicable.

attribute.name: stateIndicator
attribute.comment: This field shall be used to indicate if angle deception data have changed since issuance of the last Angle Deception attribute record for this beam, if the Angle Deception attribute record is part of a heartbeat update to meet periodic update requirements or if the angle deception data for the beam has ceased.

attribute.name: azimuthOffset
attribute.comment: This field indicates the relative azimuth angle at which the deceptive radar returns are centered. This angle is measured in the X-Y plane of the victim radar's entity coordinate system (see 1.4.3). This angle is measured in radians from the victim radar entity's azimuth for the true jam- mer position to the center of the range of azimuths in which deceptive radar returns are perceived as shown in Figure 43. Positive and negative values indicate that the perceived positions of the jammer are right and left of the true position of the jammer, respectively. The range of permissible values is -PI to PI

attribute.name: azimuthWidth
attribute.comment: indicates the range of azimuths (in radians) through which the deceptive radar returns are perceived, centered on the azimuth offset as shown in Figure 43. The range of permissible values is 0 to 2PI radians

attribute.name: azimuthPullRate
attribute.comment: This field indicates the rate (in radians per second) at which the Azimuth Offset value is changing. Positive and negative values indicate that the Azimuth Offset is moving to the right or left, respectively.

attribute.name: azimuthPullAcceleration
attribute.comment: This field indicates the rate (in radians per second squared) at which the Azimuth Pull Rate value is changing. Azimuth Pull Acceleration is defined as positive to the right and negative to the left.

attribute.name: elevationOffset
attribute.comment: This field indicates the relative elevation angle at which the deceptive radar returns begin. This angle is measured as an angle with respect to the X-Y plane of the victim radar's entity coordinate system (see 1.4.3). This angle is measured in radians from the victim radar entity's eleva- tion for the true jammer position to the center of the range of elevations in which deceptive radar returns are perceived as shown in Figure 44. Positive and negative values indicate that the perceived positions of the jammer are above and below the true position of the jammer, respectively. The range of permissible values is -PI/2 to PI/2

attribute.name: elevationWidth
attribute.comment: This field indicates the range of elevations (in radians) through which the decep- tive radar returns are perceived, centered on the elevation offset as shown in Figure 44. The range of permissible values is 0 to PI radians

attribute.name: elevationPullRate
attribute.comment: This field indicates the rate (in radians per second) at which the Elevation Off- set value is changing. Positive and negative values indicate that the Elevation Offset is moving up or down, respectively.

attribute.name: elevationPullAcceleration
attribute.comment: This field indicates the rate (in radians per second squared) at which the Elevation Pull Rate value is changing. Elevation Pull Acceleration is defined as positive to upward and negative downward.

class.name: FalseTargetsAttribute
class.comment: The False Targets attribute record shall be used to communicate discrete values that are associated with false targets jamming that cannot be referenced to an emitter mode. The values provided in the False Targets attri- bute record shall be considered valid only for the victim radar beams listed in the jamming beam's Track/Jam Data records (provided in the associated Electromagnetic Emission PDU). Section 6.2.21.3

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: record type

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: The length of the record in octets.

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

attribute.name: emitterNumber
attribute.comment: This field indicates the emitter system generating the false targets.

attribute.name: beamNumber
attribute.comment: This field indicates the jamming beam generating the false targets.

attribute.name: stateIndicator
attribute.comment: This field shall be used to indicate if false target data have changed since issuance of the last False Targets attribute record for this beam, if the False Targets attribute record is part of a heartbeat update to meet periodic update requirements or if false target data for the beam has ceased.

attribute.name: falseTargetCount
attribute.comment: This field indicates the jamming beam generating the false targets.

attribute.name: walkSpeed
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the speed (in meters per second) at which false targets move toward the victim radar. Negative values shall indicate a velocity away from the victim radar.

attribute.name: walkAcceleration
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the rate (in meters per second squared) at which false tar- gets accelerate toward the victim radar. Negative values shall indicate an acceleration direction away from the victim radar.

attribute.name: maximumWalkDistance
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the distance (in meters) that a false target is to walk before it pauses in range.

attribute.name: keepTime
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the time (in seconds) that a false target is to be held at the Maxi- mum Walk Distance before it resets to its initial position.

attribute.name: echoSpacing
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the distance between false targets in meters. Positive values for this field shall indicate that second and subsequent false targets are initially placed at increasing ranges from the victim radar.

attribute.name: firstTargetOffset
attribute.comment: Sets the position of the first false target relative to the jamming entity in meters.

class.name: EEFundamentalParameterData
class.comment: Contains electromagnetic emission regeneration parameters that are variable throught a scenario. Section 6.2.22.

attribute.name: frequency
attribute.comment: center frequency of the emission in hertz.

attribute.name: frequencyRange
attribute.comment: Bandwidth of the frequencies corresponding to the fequency field.

attribute.name: effectiveRadiatedPower
attribute.comment: Effective radiated power for the emission in DdBm. For a radar noise jammer, indicates the peak of the transmitted power.

attribute.name: pulseRepetitionFrequency
attribute.comment: Average repetition frequency of the emission in hertz.

attribute.name: pulseWidth
attribute.comment: Average pulse width of the emission in microseconds.

class.name: EmitterSystem
class.comment: This field shall specify information about a particular emitter system. Section 6.2.23.

attribute.name: emitterName
attribute.comment: Name of the emitter, 16-bit enumeration

attribute.name: emitterFunction
attribute.comment: function of the emitter, 8-bit enumeration

attribute.name: emitterIDNumber
attribute.comment: emitter ID, 8-bit enumeration

class.name: EngineFuel
class.comment: Information about an entity's engine fuel. Section 6.2.24.

attribute.name: fuelQuantity
attribute.comment: Fuel quantity, units specified by next field

attribute.name: fuelMeasurementUnits
attribute.comment: Units in which the fuel is measured

attribute.name: fuelType
attribute.comment: Type of fuel

attribute.name: fuelLocation
attribute.comment: Location of fuel as related to entity. See section 14 of EBV document

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: EngineFuelReload
class.comment: For each type or location of engine fuell, this record specifies the type, location, fuel measurement units, and reload quantity and maximum quantity. Section 6.2.25.

attribute.name: standardQuantity
attribute.comment: standard quantity of fuel loaded

attribute.name: maximumQuantity
attribute.comment: maximum quantity of fuel loaded

attribute.name: standardQuantityReloadTime
attribute.comment: seconds normally required to to reload standard qty

attribute.name: maximumQuantityReloadTime
attribute.comment: seconds normally required to to reload maximum qty

attribute.name: fuelMeasurmentUnits
attribute.comment: Units of measure

attribute.name: fuelLocation
attribute.comment: fuel location as related to the entity

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: EntityIdentifier
class.comment: Entity Identifier. Unique ID for entities in the world. Consists of an simulation address and a entity number. Section 6.2.28.

attribute.name: simulationAddress
attribute.comment: Site and application IDs

attribute.name: entityNumber
attribute.comment: Entity number

class.name: EntityID
class.comment: Unique identifier triplet for this entity. Also referred to as EntityIdentifier

attribute.name: siteID
attribute.comment: Site ID values are unique identification number for originating site, often corresponding to an internet address. Site ID values are agreed upon by individual simulations.

attribute.name: applicationID
attribute.comment: Application ID values are unique identification number for originating application at a given site. Application ID values are sssigned by individual sites.

attribute.name: entityID
attribute.comment: Entity ID values are unique identification number for s givent entity in the originating application at a given site. Entity ID values are sssigned by individual simulation programs.

class.name: EntityMarking
class.comment: Specifies the character set used in the first byte, followed by 11 characters of text data. Section 6.29

attribute.name: characterSet
attribute.comment: The character set

attribute.name: characters
attribute.comment: The characters

class.name: EntityType
class.comment: Identifies the type of Entity

attribute.name: entityKind
attribute.comment: Kind of entity

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc.)

classRef.name: Domain
classRef.comment: can be PlatformDomain or MunitionDomain enum

attribute.name: country
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: category
attribute.comment: category of entity

attribute.name: subCategory
attribute.comment: subcategory based on category

attribute.name: specific
attribute.comment: specific info based on subcategory

class.name: EntityTypeRaw
class.comment: Identifies the type of Entity

attribute.name: entityKind
attribute.comment: Kind of entity

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc.)

attribute.name: country
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: category
attribute.comment: category of entity

attribute.name: subCategory
attribute.comment: subcategory of entity

attribute.name: specific
attribute.comment: specific info based on subcategory field. Renamed from specific because that is a reserved word in SQL.

class.name: Environment
class.comment: Information about a geometry, a state associated with a geometry, a bounding volume, or an associated entity ID. 6.2.31, not fully defined. 'The current definitions can be found in DIS PCR 240'

attribute.name: environmentType
attribute.comment: Record type

attribute.name: length
attribute.comment: length, in bits

attribute.name: index
attribute.comment: Identify the sequentially numbered record index

attribute.name: geometry
attribute.comment: Geometry or state record

class.name: EulerAngles
class.comment: Three floating point values representing an orientation, psi, theta, and phi, aka the euler angles, in radians. Section 6.2.33

class.name: EventIdentifier
class.comment: Identifies an event in the world. Use this format for every PDU EXCEPT the LiveEntityPdu. Section 6.2.34.

attribute.name: simulationAddress
attribute.comment: Site and application IDs

class.name: EventIdentifierLiveEntity
class.comment: Identifies an event in the world. Use this format for ONLY the LiveEntityPdu. Section 6.2.34.

class.name: Expendable
class.comment: An entity's expendable (chaff, flares, etc.) information. Section 6.2.36

attribute.name: expendable
attribute.comment: Type of expendable

primitive.comment: See section 4.7 of EBV document for station description

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: ExpendableReload
class.comment: An entity's expendable (chaff, flares, etc.) information. Section 6.2.37

attribute.name: expendable
attribute.comment: Type of expendable

primitive.comment: See section 4.7 of EBV document for station description
Standard quantity typically loaded at this station
maximum quantity that can be loaded at this station
Seconds normally required to reload at this station
Seconds normally required to reload at this station

class.name: FixedDatum
class.comment: Fixed Datum Record. Section 6.2.37

attribute.name: fixedDatumID
attribute.comment: ID of the fixed datum, an enumeration

sisoenum.comment: uid 66 Variable Record Type values are defined by VariableRecordType enumerations

attribute.name: fixedDatumValue
attribute.comment: Value for the fixed datum

class.name: FundamentalOperationalData
class.comment: Basic operational data for IFF. Section 6.2.39

attribute.name: systemStatus
attribute.comment: system status, IEEE DIS 7 defined

attribute.name: dataField1
attribute.comment: data field 1

attribute.name: informationLayers
attribute.comment: eight boolean fields

attribute.name: parameter1
attribute.comment: parameter, enumeration

attribute.name: parameter2
attribute.comment: parameter, enumeration

attribute.name: parameter3
attribute.comment: parameter, enumeration

attribute.name: parameter4
attribute.comment: parameter, enumeration

attribute.name: parameter5
attribute.comment: parameter, enumeration

attribute.name: parameter6
attribute.comment: parameter, enumeration

class.name: GridAxisDescriptor
class.comment: Detailed information about the grid dimensions (axes) and coordinates for environmental state variables

attribute.name: domainInitialXi
attribute.comment: coordinate of the grid origin or initial value

attribute.name: domainFinalXi
attribute.comment: coordinate of the endpoint or final value

attribute.name: domainPointsXi
attribute.comment: The number of grid points along the Xi domain axis for the enviornmental state data

attribute.name: interleafFactor
attribute.comment: interleaf factor along the domain axis.

attribute.name: axisType
attribute.comment: type of grid axis

class.name: GridAxisDescriptorFixed
class.comment: Grid axis record for fixed data. Section 6.2.41

attribute.name: numberOfPointsOnXiAxis
attribute.comment: Number of grid locations along Xi axis

attribute.name: initialIndex
attribute.comment: initial grid point for the current pdu

class.name: GridAxisDescriptorVariable
class.comment: Grid axis descriptor fo variable spacing axis data.

attribute.name: numberOfPointsOnXiAxis
attribute.comment: Number of grid locations along Xi axis

attribute.name: initialIndex
attribute.comment: initial grid point for the current pdu

attribute.name: coordinateScaleXi
attribute.comment: value that linearly scales the coordinates of the grid locations for the xi axis

attribute.name: coordinateOffsetXi
attribute.comment: The constant offset value that shall be applied to the grid locations for the xi axis

attribute.name: xiValues
attribute.comment: list of coordinates

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: GroupID
class.comment: Unique designation of a group of entities contained in the isGroupOfPdu. Represents a group of entities rather than a single entity. Section 6.2.43

attribute.name: simulationAddress
attribute.comment: Simulation address (site and application number)

attribute.name: groupNumber
attribute.comment: group number

sisoenum.comment: uid 66 Variable Record Type values are defined by VariableRecordType enumerations

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

sisoenum.comment: uid 66 Variable Record Type values are defined by VariableRecordType enumerations

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: CommunicationsNodeID
class.comment: Identity of a communications node. Section 6.2.48.4

class.name: IFFData
class.comment: repeating element in IFF Data specification record

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: enumeration for type of record

sisoenum.comment: uid 66 Variable Record Type values are defined by VariableRecordType enumerations

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: length of record, including padding

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: IFFDataSpecification
class.comment: Requires hand coding to be useful. Section 6.2.43

attribute.name: numberOfIFFDataRecords
attribute.comment: Number of IFF records

attribute.name: iffDataRecords
attribute.comment: IFF data records

class.name: IFFFundamentalParameterData
class.comment: Fundamental IFF atc data. Section 6.2.44

attribute.name: pulseWidth
attribute.comment: Pulse width

attribute.name: burstLength
attribute.comment: Burst length

attribute.name: applicableModes
attribute.comment: Applicable modes enumeration

attribute.name: systemSpecificData
attribute.comment: System-specific data

class.name: IntercomCommunicationsParameters
class.comment: Intercom communications parameters. Section 6.2.46

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: Type of intercom parameters record

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: length of record

attribute.name: recordSpecificField
attribute.comment: This is a placeholder.

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: IntercomIdentifier
class.comment: Unique designation of an attached or unattached intercom in an event or exercirse. Section 6.2.48

class.name: JammingTechnique
class.comment: Jamming technique. Section 6.2.49, uid 284

class.name: LaunchedMunitionRecord
class.comment: Identity of a communications node. Section 6.2.50

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: LayerHeader
class.comment: The identification of the additional information layer number, layer-specific information, and the length of the layer. Section 6.2.51

attribute.name: layerSpecificInformation
attribute.comment: field shall specify layer-specific information that varies by System Type (see 6.2.86) and Layer Number.

attribute.name: length
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the length in octets of the layer, including the Layer Header record

class.name: LinearSegmentParameter
class.comment: The specification of an individual segment of a linear segment synthetic environment object in a Linear Object State PDU Section 6.2.52

attribute.name: segmentNumber
attribute.comment: The individual segment of the linear segment

attribute.name: segmentModification
attribute.comment: whether a modification has been made to the point object's location or orientation

attribute.name: generalSegmentAppearance
attribute.comment: general dynamic appearance attributes of the segment. This record shall be defined as a 16-bit record of enumerations. The values defined for this record are included in Section 12 of SISO-REF-010.

attribute.name: specificSegmentAppearance
attribute.comment: This field shall specify specific dynamic appearance attributes of the segment. This record shall be defined as a 32-bit record of enumerations.

attribute.name: segmentLocation
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the location of the linear segment in the simulated world and shall be represented by a World Coordinates record

attribute.name: segmentOrientation
attribute.comment: orientation of the linear segment about the segment location and shall be represented by a Euler Angles record

attribute.name: segmentLength
attribute.comment: length of the linear segment, in meters, extending in the positive X direction

attribute.name: segmentWidth
attribute.comment: The total width of the linear segment, in meters, shall be specified by a 16-bit unsigned integer. One-half of the width shall extend in the positive Y direction, and one-half of the width shall extend in the negative Y direction.

attribute.name: segmentHeight
attribute.comment: The height of the linear segment, in meters, above ground shall be specified by a 16-bit unsigned integer.

attribute.name: segmentDepth
attribute.comment: The depth of the linear segment, in meters, below ground level

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: LiveEntityIdentifier
class.comment: The unique designation of each entity in an event or exercise that is contained in a Live Entity PDU. Section 6.2.54

attribute.name: liveSimulationAddress
attribute.comment: Live Simulation Address record (see 6.2.54)

attribute.name: entityNumber
attribute.comment: Live entity number

class.name: LiveSimulationAddress
class.comment: A simulation's designation associated with all Live Entity IDs contained in Live Entity PDUs. Section 6.2.55

attribute.name: liveSiteNumber
attribute.comment: facility, installation, organizational unit or geographic location may have multiple sites associated with it. The Site Number is the first component of the Live Simulation Address, which defines a live simulation.

attribute.name: liveApplicationNumber
attribute.comment: An application associated with a live site is termed a live application. Each live application participating in an event

class.name: MineEntityIdentifier
class.comment: The unique designation of a mine contained in the Minefield Data PDU. No espdus are issued for mine entities. Section 6.2.55

class.name: MinefieldIdentifier
class.comment: The unique designation of a minefield Section 6.2.56

class.name: MinefieldSensorType
class.comment: Information about a minefield sensor. Section 6.2.57

attribute.name: sensorType
attribute.comment: sensor type. bit fields 0-3 are the type category, 4-15 are teh subcategory

class.name: ModulationParameters
class.comment: Modulation parameters associated with a specific radio system. 6.2.58

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: ModulationType
class.comment: Information about the type of modulation used for radio transmission. 6.2.59

attribute.name: spreadSpectrum
attribute.comment: This field shall indicate the spread spectrum technique or combination of spread spectrum techniques in use. Bit field. 0=freq hopping, 1=psuedo noise, time hopping=2, reamining bits unused

attribute.name: majorModulation
attribute.comment: The major classification of the modulation type.

attribute.name: detail
attribute.comment: provide certain detailed information depending upon the major modulation type, uid 156-162

attribute.name: radioSystem
attribute.comment: The radio system associated with this Transmitter PDU and shall be used as the basis to interpret other fields whose values depend on a specific radio system.

class.name: Munition
class.comment: An entity's munition (e.g., bomb, missile) information shall be represented by one or more Munition records. For each type or location of munition, this record shall specify the type, location, quantity and status of munitions that an entity contains. Section 6.2.60

attribute.name: munitionType
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the entity type of the munition. See section 6.2.30.

attribute.name: station
attribute.comment: The station or launcher to which the munition is assigned. See Annex I

attribute.name: quantity
attribute.comment: The quantity remaining of this munition.

attribute.name: munitionStatus
attribute.comment: the status of the munition. It shall be represented by an 8-bit enumeration.

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: MunitionReload
class.comment: indicate weapons (munitions) previously communicated via the Munition record. Section 6.2.61

attribute.name: munitionType
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the entity type of the munition. See section 6.2.30.

attribute.name: station
attribute.comment: The station or launcher to which the munition is assigned. See Annex I

attribute.name: standardQuantity
attribute.comment: The standard quantity of this munition type normally loaded at this station/launcher if a station/launcher is specified.

attribute.name: maximumQuantity
attribute.comment: The maximum quantity of this munition type that this station/launcher is capable of holding when a station/launcher is specified

attribute.name: standardQuantityReloadTime
attribute.comment: numer of seconds of sim time required to reload the std qty

attribute.name: maximumQuantityReloadTime
attribute.comment: The number of seconds of sim time required to reload the max possible quantity

class.name: NamedLocationIdentification
class.comment: Information about the discrete positional relationship of the part entity with respect to the its host entity Section 6.2.62

attribute.name: stationName
attribute.comment: The station name within the host at which the part entity is located. If the part entity is On Station, this field shall specify the representation of the part's location data fields. This field shall be specified by a 16-bit enumeration

attribute.name: stationNumber
attribute.comment: The number of the particular wing station, cargo hold etc., at which the part is attached.

class.name: ObjectIdentifier
class.comment: The unique designation of an environmental object. Section 6.2.63

attribute.name: simulationAddress
attribute.comment: Simulation Address

attribute.name: objectNumber
attribute.comment: object number

class.name: ObjectType
class.comment: The unique designation of an environmental object. Section 6.2.64

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc.)

attribute.name: objectKind
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: category
attribute.comment: category of entity

attribute.name: subCategory
attribute.comment: subcategory of entity

class.name: OwnershipStatusRecord
class.comment: used to convey entity and conflict status information associated with transferring ownership of an entity. Section 6.2.65

attribute.name: ownershipStatus
attribute.comment: The ownership and/or ownership conflict status of the entity represented by the Entity ID field.

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: PropulsionSystemData
class.comment: contains information describing the propulsion systems of the entity. This information shall be provided for each active propulsion system defined. Section 6.2.68

attribute.name: engineRpm
attribute.comment: engine RPMs

class.name: ProtocolMode
class.comment: Bit field used to identify minefield data. bits 14-15 are a 2-bit enum, other bits unused. Section 6.2.69

attribute.name: protocolMode
attribute.comment: Bitfields, 14-15 contain an enum, uid 336

class.name: RadioIdentifier
class.comment: The unique designation of an attached or unattached radio in an event or exercise Section 6.2.70

attribute.name: siteNumber
attribute.comment: site

attribute.name: applicationNumber
attribute.comment: application number

attribute.name: referenceNumber
attribute.comment: reference number

attribute.name: radioNumber
attribute.comment: Radio number

class.name: RadioType
class.comment: Identifies the type of radio. Section 6.2.71

attribute.name: entityKind
attribute.comment: Kind of entity

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc.)

attribute.name: country
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: category
attribute.comment: category of entity

attribute.name: subcategory
attribute.comment: specific info based on subcategory field

class.name: RecordQuerySpecification
class.comment: The identification of the records being queried 6.2.72

attribute.name: recordIDs
attribute.comment: variable length list of 32-bit record types

class.name: RecordSpecificationElement
class.comment:
Synthetic record, made up from section 6.2.73. This is used to achieve a repeating variable list element.

recordLength, recordCount and recordValues must be set by hand so the.

attribute.name: recordID
attribute.comment: The data structure used to convey the parameter values of the record for each record. 32-bit enumeration.

attribute.name: recordSetSerialNumber
attribute.comment: The serial number of the first record in the block of records

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: the length, in bits, of the record. Note, bits, not bytes.

attribute.name: recordCount
attribute.comment: the number of records included in the record set

attribute.name: recordValues
attribute.comment: The concatenated records of the format specified by the Record ID field. The length of this field is the Record Length multiplied by the Record Count, in units of bits.

attribute.name: padTo64
attribute.comment: used if required to make entire record size an even multiple of 8 bytes

class.name: RecordSpecification
class.comment: This record shall specify the number of record sets contained in the Record Specification record and the record details. Section 6.2.73.

attribute.name: numberOfRecordSets
attribute.comment: The number of record sets

attribute.name: recordSets
attribute.comment: variable length list record specifications.

class.name: Relationship
class.comment: The relationship of the part entity to its host entity. Section 6.2.74.

attribute.name: nature
attribute.comment: The nature or purpose for joining of the part entity to the host entity and shall be represented by a 16-bit enumeration

attribute.name: position
attribute.comment: The position of the part entity with respect to the host entity and shall be represented by a 16-bit enumeration

class.name: RequestID
class.comment: A monotonically increasing number inserted into all simulation managment PDUs. This should be a hand-coded thingie, maybe a singleton. Section 6.2.75

attribute.name: requestID
attribute.comment: monotonically increasing number

class.name: SecondaryOperationalData
class.comment: Additional operational data for an IFF emitting system and the number of IFF Fundamental Parameter Data records Section 6.2.76.

attribute.name: operationalData1
attribute.comment: additional operational characteristics of the IFF emitting system. Each 8-bit field will vary depending on the system type.

attribute.name: operationalData2
attribute.comment: additional operational characteristics of the IFF emitting system. Each 8-bit field will vary depending on the system type.

attribute.name: numberOfIFFFundamentalParameterRecords
attribute.comment: The number of IFF Fundamental Parameter Data records that follow

class.name: Sensor
class.comment: An entity's sensor information. Section 6.2.77.

attribute.name: sensorTypeSource
attribute.comment: the source of the Sensor Type field

attribute.name: sensorOnOffStatus
attribute.comment: The on/off status of the sensor

attribute.name: sensorType
attribute.comment: for Source 'other':SensorRecordOtherActiveSensors/325,'em':EmitterName/75,'passive':SensorRecordSensorTypePassiveSensors/326,'mine':6.2.57,'ua':UAAcousticSystemName/144,'lasers':DesignatorSystemName/80

attribute.name: station
attribute.comment: the station to which the sensor is assigned. A zero value shall indi- cate that this Sensor record is not associated with any particular station and represents the total quan- tity of this sensor for this entity. If this field is non-zero, it shall either reference an attached part or an articulated part

attribute.name: quantity
attribute.comment: quantity of the sensor

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: ShaftRPM
class.comment: Current Shaft RPM, Ordered Shaft RPM for use by Underwater Acoustic (UA) PDU. Section 7.6.4

class.name: SilentEntitySystem
class.comment: information abou an enitity not producing espdus. Section 6.2.79

attribute.name: numberOfEntities
attribute.comment: number of the type specified by the entity type field

attribute.name: numberOfAppearanceRecords
attribute.comment: number of entity appearance records that follow

attribute.name: entityType
attribute.comment: Entity type

attribute.name: appearanceRecordList
attribute.comment: Variable length list of appearance records

class.name: SimulationAddress
class.comment: A Simulation Address record shall consist of the Site Identification number and the Application Identification number. Section 6.2.79

attribute.name: site
attribute.comment: A site is defined as a facility, installation, organizational unit or a geographic location that has one or more simulation applications capable of participating in a distributed event.

attribute.name: application
attribute.comment: An application is defined as a software program that is used to generate and process distributed simulation data including live, virtual and constructive data.

class.name: SimulationIdentifier
class.comment: The unique designation of a simulation when using the 48-bit identifier format shall be specified by the Sim- ulation Identifier record. The reason that the 48-bit format is required in addition to the 32-bit simulation address format that actually identifies a specific simulation is because some 48-bit identifier fields in PDUs may contain either an Object Identifier, such as an Entity ID, or a Simulation Identifier. Section 6.2.80

attribute.name: simulationAddress
attribute.comment: Simulation address

attribute.name: referenceNumber
attribute.comment: This field shall be set to zero as there is no reference number associated with a Simulation Identifier.

class.name: StandardVariableSpecification
class.comment: Does not work, and causes failure in anything it is embedded in. Section 6.2.83

attribute.name: numberOfStandardVariableRecords
attribute.comment: Number of static variable records

attribute.name: standardVariables
attribute.comment: variable length list of standard variables, The class type and length here are WRONG and will cause the incorrect serialization of any class in whihc it is embedded.

class.name: StandardVariableRecord
class.comment: Section 6.2.83

sisoenum.comment: uid 66 Variable Record Type values are defined by VariableRecordType enumerations

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: StorageFuel
class.comment: Information about an entity's engine fuel. Section 6.2.84.

attribute.name: fuelQuantity
attribute.comment: Fuel quantity, units specified by next field

attribute.name: fuelMeasurementUnits
attribute.comment: Units in which the fuel is measured

attribute.name: fuelType
attribute.comment: Type of fuel

attribute.name: fuelLocation
attribute.comment: Location of fuel as related to entity. See section 14 of EBV document

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: StorageFuelReload
class.comment: For each type or location of Storage Fuel, this record shall specify the type, location, fuel measure- ment units, reload quantity and maximum quantity for storage fuel either for the whole entity or a specific storage fuel location (tank). Section 6.2.85.

attribute.name: standardQuantity
attribute.comment: the standard quantity of this fuel type normally loaded at this station/launcher if a station/launcher is specified. If the Station/Launcher field is set to zero, then this is the total quantity of this fuel type that would be present in a standard reload of all appli- cable stations/launchers associated with this entity.

attribute.name: maximumQuantity
attribute.comment: The maximum quantity of this fuel type that this sta- tion/launcher is capable of holding when a station/launcher is specified. This would be the value used when a maximum reload was desired to be set for this station/launcher. If the Station/launcher field is set to zero, then this is the maximum quantity of this fuel type that would be present on this entity at all stations/launchers that can accept this fuel type.

attribute.name: standardQuantityReloadTime
attribute.comment: The seconds normally required to reload the standard quantity of this fuel type at this specific station/launcher. When the Station/Launcher field is set to zero, this shall be the time it takes to perform a standard quantity reload of this fuel type at all applicable stations/launchers for this entity.

attribute.name: maximumQuantityReloadTime
attribute.comment: The seconds normally required to reload the maximum possible quantity of this fuel type at this station/launcher. When the Station/Launcher field is set to zero, this shall be the time it takes to perform a maximum quantity load/reload of this fuel type at all applicable stations/launchers for this entity.

attribute.name: fuelMeasurementUnits
attribute.comment: The fuel measurement units. Enumeration

attribute.name: fuelType
attribute.comment: Fuel type

attribute.name: fuelLocation
attribute.comment: Location of fuel as related to entity. See section 14 of EBV document

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: SupplyQuantity
class.comment: A supply, and the amount of that supply. Section 6.2.86

attribute.name: supplyType
attribute.comment: Type of supply

attribute.name: quantity
attribute.comment: The number of units of a supply type.

class.name: SystemIdentifier
class.comment: The ID of the IFF emitting system. Section 6.2.87

attribute.name: systemType
attribute.comment: general type of emitting system, an enumeration

attribute.name: systemName
attribute.comment: named type of system, an enumeration

attribute.name: systemMode
attribute.comment: mode of operation for the system, an enumeration

attribute.name: changeOptions
attribute.comment: status of this PDU, see section 6.2.15

class.name: TotalRecordSets
class.comment: Total number of record sets contained in a logical set of one or more PDUs. Used to transfer ownership, etc Section 6.2.88

attribute.name: totalRecordSets
attribute.comment: Total number of record sets

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: TrackJamData
class.comment: Track-Jam data Section 6.2.89

attribute.name: entityID
attribute.comment: The entity tracked or illumated, or an emitter beam targeted with jamming

attribute.name: emitterNumber
attribute.comment: Emitter system associated with the entity

attribute.name: beamNumber
attribute.comment: Beam associated with the entity

class.name: UAFundamentalParameter
class.comment: Regeneration parameters for active emission systems that are variable throughout a scenario. Section 6.2.91

attribute.name: activeEmissionParameterIndex
attribute.comment: Which database record shall be used

attribute.name: scanPattern
attribute.comment: The type of scan pattern, If not used, zero

attribute.name: beamCenterAzimuthHorizontal
attribute.comment: center azimuth bearing of th emain beam. In radians.

attribute.name: azimuthalBeamwidthHorizontal
attribute.comment: Horizontal beamwidth of th emain beam Meastued at the 3dB down point of peak radiated power. In radians.

attribute.name: beamCenterDepressionElevation
attribute.comment: center of the d/e angle of th emain beam relative to the stablised de angle of the target. In radians.

attribute.name: depressionElevationBeamWidth
attribute.comment: vertical beamwidth of the main beam. Meastured at the 3dB down point of peak radiated power. In radians.

class.name: UnattachedIdentifier
class.comment: The unique designation of one or more unattached radios in an event or exercise Section 6.2.91

attribute.name: referenceNumber
attribute.comment: Reference number

class.name: VariableDatum
class.comment: The variable datum type, the datum length, and the value for that variable datum type. Section 6.2.93

attribute.name: variableDatumID
attribute.comment: Type of variable datum to be transmitted. 32-bit enumeration defined in EBV

sisoenum.comment: uid 66 Variable Record Type values are defined by VariableRecordType enumerations

attribute.name: variableDatumLength
attribute.comment: Length, IN BITS, of the variable datum.

attribute.name: variableDatumValue
attribute.comment: This can be any number of bits long, depending on the datum.

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: VariableParameter
class.comment: used in DetonationPdu, ArticulatedPartsPdu among others

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: The identification of the Variable Parameter record. Enumeration from EBV

attribute.name: recordSpecificFields
attribute.comment: 120 bits

class.name: ArticulatedPartVP
class.comment: articulated parts for movable parts and a combination of moveable/attached parts of an entity. Section 6.2.94.2

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: The identification of the Variable Parameter record. Enumeration from EBV

attribute.name: changeIndicator
attribute.comment: indicate the change of any parameter for any articulated part. Starts at zero, incremented for each change

attribute.name: partAttachedTo
attribute.comment: The identification of the articulated part to which this articulation parameter is attached. This field shall be specified by a 16-bit unsigned integer. This field shall contain the value zero if the articulated part is attached directly to the entity.

attribute.name: parameterType
attribute.comment: The type of parameter represented, 32-bit enumeration

attribute.name: parameterValue
attribute.comment: The definition of the 64-bits shall be determined based on the type of parameter specified in the Parameter Type field

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: AttachedPartVP
class.comment: Removable parts that may be attached to an entity. Section 6.2.93.3

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: The identification of the Variable Parameter record. Enumeration from EBV

attribute.name: detachedIndicator
attribute.comment: 0 = attached, 1 = detached. See I.2.3.1 for state transition diagram

attribute.name: partAttachedTo
attribute.comment: The identification of the articulated part to which this articulation parameter is attached. This field shall be specified by a 16-bit unsigned integer. This field shall contain the value zero if the articulated part is attached directly to the entity.

attribute.name: parameterType
attribute.comment: The location or station to which the part is attached

attribute.name: attachedPartType
attribute.comment: The definition of the 64-bits shall be determined based on the type of parameter specified in the Parameter Type field

class.name: EntityAssociationVP
class.comment: Association or disassociation of two entities. Section 6.2.94.4.3

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: The identification of the Variable Parameter record. Enumeration from EBV

attribute.name: changeIndicator
attribute.comment: Indicates if this VP has changed since last issuance

attribute.name: associationStatus
attribute.comment: Indicates association status between two entities

attribute.name: associationType
attribute.comment: Type of association; 8-bit enum

attribute.name: entityID
attribute.comment: Object ID of entity associated with this entity

attribute.name: ownStationLocation
attribute.comment: Station location on one's own entity

attribute.name: physicalConnectionType
attribute.comment: Type of physical connection

attribute.name: groupMemberType
attribute.comment: Type of member the entity is within the group

attribute.name: groupNumber
attribute.comment: Group if any to which the entity belongs

class.name: EntityTypeVP
class.comment: Association or disassociation of two entities. Section 6.2.94.5

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: The identification of the Variable Parameter record.

attribute.name: changeIndicator
attribute.comment: Indicates if this VP has changed since last issuance

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: SeparationVP
class.comment: Physical separation of an entity from another entity. Section 6.2.94.6

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: The identification of the Variable Parameter record. Enumeration from EBV

attribute.name: reasonForSeparation
attribute.comment: Reason for separation. EBV

attribute.name: preEntityIndicator
attribute.comment: Whether the entity existed prior to separation EBV

attribute.name: parentEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of parent

attribute.name: stationLocation
attribute.comment: Station separated from

class.name: VariableTransmitterParameters
class.comment: Relates to radios. Section 6.2.95

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: Type of VTP

sisoenum.comment: uid 66 Variable Record Type values are defined by VariableRecordType enumerations

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: Length, in bytes

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: Vector3Float
class.comment: Three floating point values, x, y, and z. Section 6.2.95

attribute.name: x
attribute.comment: X value

attribute.name: y
attribute.comment: y Value

attribute.name: z
attribute.comment: Z value

class.name: Vector2Float
class.comment: Two floating point values, x, y

attribute.name: x
attribute.comment: X value

attribute.name: y
attribute.comment: y Value

class.name: VectoringNozzleSystem
class.comment: Operational data for describing the vectoring nozzle systems Section 6.2.96

attribute.name: horizontalDeflectionAngle
attribute.comment: In degrees

attribute.name: verticalDeflectionAngle
attribute.comment: In degrees

class.name: Vector3Double
class.comment: Three double precision floating point values, x, y, and z. Used for world coordinates Section 6.2.97.

attribute.name: x
attribute.comment: X value

attribute.name: y
attribute.comment: y Value

attribute.name: z
attribute.comment: Z value

class.name: DeadReckoningParameters
class.comment: Not specified in the standard. This is used by the ESPDU

attribute.name: deadReckoningAlgorithm
attribute.comment: Algorithm to use in computing dead reckoning. See EBV doc.

attribute.name: parameters
attribute.comment: Dead reckoning parameters. Contents depends on algorithm.

attribute.name: entityLinearAcceleration
attribute.comment: Linear acceleration of the entity

attribute.name: entityAngularVelocity
attribute.comment: Angular velocity of the entity

class.name: LiveEntityRelativeWorldCoordinates
class.comment: 16-bit fixed binaries

class.name: LiveEntityLinearVelocity
class.comment: 16-bit fixed binaries

class.name: LiveEntityOrientation
class.comment: 8-bit fixed binaries

class.name: LiveEntityOrientation16
class.comment: 16-bit fixed binaries

class.name: LiveEntityPositionError
class.comment: 16-bit fixed binaries

class.name: LiveEntityOrientationError
class.comment: 16-bit fixed binaries

class.name: LEVector3FixedByte
class.comment: 3 x 8-bit fixed binary

attribute.name: x
attribute.comment: X value

attribute.name: y
attribute.comment: y Value

attribute.name: z
attribute.comment: Z value

class.name: LiveDeadReckoningParameters
class.comment: 16-bit fixed binaries

class.name: Pdu
class.comment: Base class of PduBase and LiveEntityPdu

attribute.name: protocolVersion
attribute.comment: The version of the protocol. 5=DIS-1995, 6=DIS-1998, 7=DIS-2012

attribute.name: exerciseID
attribute.comment: Exercise ID provides a unique identifier

attribute.name: pduType
attribute.comment: Type of pdu, unique for each PDU class

attribute.name: protocolFamily
attribute.comment: value that refers to the protocol family, eg SimulationManagement, et

attribute.name: timestamp
attribute.comment: Timestamp value, int representing number of 1.675 microseconds as interval past hour

attribute.name: length
attribute.comment: Length, in bytes, of the PDU

class.name: PduBase
class.comment: The superclass for all PDUs except LiveEntity. This incorporates the PduHeader record, section 7.2.2

attribute.name: pduStatus
attribute.comment: PDU Status Record. Described in 6.2.67. This field is not present in earlier DIS versions

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding bits for byte alignment and consistent sizing of PDU data

class.name: PduStatus
class.comment: PduStatus provides a set of bit-masked indicator values, section 6.2.67. Bit fields include Transferred Entity Indicator (TEI), LVC Indicator (LVC), Coupled Extension Indicator (CEI), Fire Type Indicator (FTI), Detonation Type Indicator (DTI), Radio Attached Indicator (RAI), Intercom Attached Indicator (IAI), IFF Simulation Mode (ISM) and Active Interrogation Indicator (AII).

attribute.name: value
attribute.comment: PDU Status Record value containing bitmasked field
